comment: The worst professor I have had! She does not give feedback in a timely manner. My classmates were dropping like flies because thats how bad she was. I still managed to pass but she would make up stuff as we go and never  completely followed the syllabus.

She grades extremely hard and assigns a ton of work. She is extremely disorganized and doesn't follow her own syllabus. Attendance is mandatory but it's hard to want to keep attending a class when the professor rarely puts in grades. It's insane that she is the only professor who teaches this course.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This is truly the worst professor ever. She grades so heavily for 2 credit class. It is very unorganized and spends a lot of time teaching about nothing related to our final paper. Gave us a quiz not related to anything we learned in class. Doesn't put grades in until the end of the semester. Awful teacher overall

Very unorganized prof, never uploads things to d2l. She says she will upload ppts and assignments but doesnt. Never grades anything and doesnt respond to emails. Very unclear directions and doesnt help u study for lockdown browser quizes or exams that use webcam. Quizzes u on info u havent even learned yet. Unorganized class with WAY to much work
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Compiled with very difficult work. Remove points after telling you the assignment looks good. When you have questions, answer them with a question instead of helping you understand the material. A tough grader. Not personable and doesn't have a good professor-to-student connection. Not a professor to confide in and does not respond back to emails.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER. I've never made below a B & ended with a D. The amount of work she assigns is UNREAL & there's not enough time to complete it. If you take her, make sure you're not taking any class that assigns homework or you'll fail. She expects you to only focus on her class & write like a graduate student. Gives very unclear directions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She assigns extremely way too much work for a 2 credit class. She does not take into consideration the unnecessary time and energy her work requires. Unfortunately she is the only teacher available for this course so students aren't able to gain a better experience. Just be prepared when registering that having a full schedule may not be ideal.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Not a bad professor but just super late grading assignments. We did a semester long paper and she wouldn't give back feedback for part 1 until after part 2 (and sometimes part 3) were due & then would dock points for not fixing those mistakes. If you schedule office hours with her though, she'll give feedback then so you just have to be active

She takes MONTHS to grade simple assignments and papers. You will get late feed back and do poorly on future assignments that could have been prevented by getting feedback on time. Not sure why she's even employed here. She also only emails you back if she feels like it because she's "also busy". What a joke.

Such a harsh grader. Docks you for not doing exactly what she asks for but doesnt give good feedback until your 4 discussion posts in. Very anal about work- maybe too much for a two credit class. Run while you still can.

This class is hard and you DEFINITELY have to work for your grade, but she isn't a bad professor. She is incredibly caring and knows a lot about the subject she's teaching. She's always willing to help her students, you only struggle in the class if you don't do your work and don't pay attention. She is really late at grading stuff which sucks.

She did give good feedback on the papers for intro but gives a disproportion amount of work compared to other professors (all very time comsuming). For theory she makes you outline your textbook chapters (also time consuming). She's a nice person, but as a teacher she's super high stress.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Ukuku gives an OVERWHELMING amount of work . There's an assignment due like every other day and they are not easy. Ukuku treats this class like a 4000+ level class. Directions were never clear and she graded HARSH. She never grades in a timely manner. Avoid taking her at all costs.

Dr. Ukuku is a very caring professor but she is so unorganized. She never grades anything until the very last second. Doesn't post materials until the very last second. She isn't clear about what she wants on anything and then she grades very harsh. She doesn't follow her syllabus. Love her as a person but very frustrating to have as a teacher.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: This class is an immense amount of work, so much so that she can't keep up with grading. Considering that prior assignments are essential to upcoming ones, this generates a pretty serious issue. She also grades randomly, as my group had an ongoing issue that was never addressed until the final project. It was apparent she had not read our papers.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: an awesome teacher, makes things clear, & can answer any questions you have abt the material but grades very roughly, reading assignments every week for weekly outlines, & tests arent too difficult if u read and understand the material but very detailed and she likes long responses. If u have a full load, Id suggest taking another semester
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Test heavy
